intro: Uvifera cujabensis, commonly known as the Cujabensis uvifera, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a velvety texture. Uvifera cujabensis is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical environments with high rainfall.
